meanings.definition: To summarize or repeat the main points of something.
meanings.sent1: She recapitulated the story for her friend.
meanings.sent2: The teacher recapitulated the lesson at the end of class.
meanings.sent3: The parrot recapitulated the tune it had just heard.
meanings.sent4: His speech recapitulated the key arguments in a clear manner.
meanings.sent5: The tour guide recapitulated the history of the ancient ruins with enthusiasm.

meanings.definition: To go over or review something briefly.
meanings.sent1: He quickly recapitulated the main points of the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The student recapitulated the key facts before the exam.
meanings.sent3: The cat recapitulated its grooming routine in record time.
meanings.sent4: The athlete recapitulated the race in his mind after crossing the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The chef recapitulated the recipe before starting to cook.

meanings.definition: To restate or reiterate something briefly.
meanings.sent1: The manager recapitulated the company's policy on punctuality.
meanings.sent2: She recapitulated her request for a day off.
meanings.sent3: The child recapitulated his apology to his friend.
meanings.sent4: The singer recapitulated the chorus for emphasis.
meanings.sent5: The lawyer recapitulated the key points of the case during closing arguments.
